intro: Allantospermum borneense subsp. rostratum, commonly known as the long-beaked allantospermum, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
